meanings.definition: To make something seem larger, more important, or more extreme than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overexaggerate her accomplishments when talking to her friends.
meanings.sent2: It's not good to overexaggerate your abilities on a job application.
meanings.sent3: He always overexaggerates the size of the fish he caught, making it a funny story.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement over the new movie release caused her to overexaggerate its quality.
meanings.sent5: The children's game of telephone often results in messages being overexaggerated along the way.
